oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1955-10-01 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 1, 1955. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer) with the Texas Troubadours, guest performer Red Sovine (although Goldie Hill was advertised as the guest for this week on the previous show), and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, Lew Childre, Del Wood, Minnie Pearl, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ernest Tubb; Rod Brasfield; Red Sovine; Tommy Jackson; Lew Childre; Del Wood
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Ernest Tubb -- The Yellow Rose Of Texas (Ernest Tubb) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Ernest Tubb) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Red Sovine -- My New Love Affair (Red Sovine) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Tommy Jackson and Lew Childre -- Mississippi Sawyer (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Lew Childre calls) -- Ernest Tubb talks -- Stand By Me (Ernest Tubb) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Prince Albert jingle (Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Del Wood -- Rocky Mountain Express (Del Wood)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Texas Troubadours; Byrd, Billy; Brasfield, Rod; Wood, Del; Jackson, Tommy; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Minnie Pearl; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Sovine, Red
